Object.Field:
COMPONENT NAME: IKM SQL to Teradata (TTU) COMPONENT VERSION: 10.1.3.3 AUTHOR: Oracle COMPATIBILITY: ODI 10.1.3.5.0 and above
DESCRIPTION Integration from any ISO SQL staging area to Teradata using either FastLoad, MultiLoad, TPump or Parallel Transporter. This KM executes the following steps: 1. Unloads the data from the staging area to a flat file located in the TEMP_DIR directory using SnpsSqlUnload 2. Loads the data in the target table by using either fastload ,multiload, tpump or parallel transporter utility 3. Removes the temporary data files created (if specified with the DEL_TEMP_FILES option) When used with NP_USE_NAMED_PIPED=1 the KM proceeds as follows: 1. Create names pipe (UNIX only) 2. Startup load utility and includes access module for named pipes 3. Wait for NP_TTU_STARTUP_TIME to let the utility initialize and on windows let it create the pipe 4. Verify that utility process is still alive before 5. Unload data from source into pipe using JSnpsSqlUnload class 6. Waits for load process to finish Utility output is captured into log file in background thread. If JSnpsSqlUnload raises an exception (e.g. SQL syntax error), utility process is killed and named pipe is deleted (UNIX only) Allows to use INSERT, UPSERT (default) or DELETE capabilities of MULTILOAD and TPUMP Utilities (specified with the MULTILOAD_TPUMP_TYPE option) In most of the cases, it is more efficient to use the "IKM Teradata Incremental Update" rather than this KM to perform Inserts and Updates. Both methods should be tested depending on your environment. Additional information can be found in the Teradata Utilities Documentation.
BASIC CONFIGURATION - Make sure that the Data Server checkbox is checked in your Topology for the Teradata Technology and specify your Teradata server host in the Server field of your Data Server definition. To do that: 1. Edit the "Teradata" Technology definition in the Topology 2. Check the Naming Rules -> Using "Data Server" checkbox 3. Used Term : "Server" 4. Apply your changes 5. Edit your Teradata Dataserver definiton 6. In the Server field, enter the IP name of your Teradata Server (without "COPn") - The host of the ODI Agent running the job must have the Teradata Client Utilities installed (fastload ,multiload, tpump, tpt) - Set the staging area to a different location than the target by selecting logical schema of the source in the definition tab of the interface. - An Update Key must be defined when using multiload and tpump UPSERT or DELETE mode. - Error messages like ...snpssqlunload...java.io.FileNotFoundException: \\.\pipe\odi_pipe_209025_SS_0 (The system cannot find the file specified)... may be raised due to insufficient NP_TTU_STARTUP_TIME - When using TPT, you may need to remove TPT checkpoint files after having submitted an erroneous interface. - When using TPT detailed logs are available using: tlogview -j <Job Id>
OPTIONS (Refer to Option descriptions for more information on each option) - REPORT_NB_ROWS: List summary of load report in ODI log? - SESSIONS: Min and/or max number of Teradata load sessions to use - DEL_TEMP_FILES: Remove temp files after load? - FIELD_SEP: Column separator for dump file/ pipe - TEMP_DIR: Directory for storing temporary files - PRIMARY_INDEX: Specify primary index to be used on target table - TERADATA_UTILITY: Which Teradata load utility to use? - MAX_ALLOWED_ERRORS: specify Teradata ERRLIMIT - DELETE_ALL: Delete all from target before loading? - VALIDATE: Validate KM options? - NP_USE_NAMED_PIPE: Use named pipe instead of file unload? - NP_ACCESS_MODULE_NAME: Name of Teradata access module for piped mode - NP_TTU_STARTUP_TIME: Delay to allow TTU to startup and create pipe - NP_EXEC_ON_WINDOWS: Will executing agent run on Windows? - CREATE_TARG_TABLE: Create target table? - MULTILOAD_TPUMP_TYPE:insert, upsert or delete script for MLoad/ TPump - DROP_TTU_TABLES: Drop Teradata utility tables before load? - ODI_DDL: Specify, what DDL to be generated?
LIMITATIONS - An Update Key must be defined when using multiload and tpump UPSERT or DELETE mode. - The REPORT_NB_ROWS option generates a warning in the ODI Log. The error message of the task contains the report of the number of rows processed. - When using fastload utility, the KM will NOT DELETE all the data of the target table before calling the fastload utility for inserting the data of the generated file into the target table (use the option DELETE_ALL in order to do so). - The fastload or multiload command scripts should be stored in a secured directory as they may contain passwords for the Teradata database. They can be deleted by the KM at the end of the job if the DEL_TEMP_FILES option is set to Yes. - FLOW_CONTROL not supported. Use LKM SQL to Teradata (TTU) + IKM instead. - The STATIC_CONTROL option call the Check Knowledge Module to isolate invalid data (if no CKM is set, an error occurs). This option must be set to NO in the case when an Integration Interface populates a TEMPORARY target datastore. - INTERVAL, TIME and TIME ZONEd data types are not/ partially supported. - DATE and TIMESTAMPs are handled down to miliseconds - DATE and TIMESTAMPs are not supported for TERADATA_UTILITY=FASTLOAD and TPT-LOAD (FastLoad protocol permits only single data type conversion, but two are needed for DATE and TIMESTAMPs). Please use LKM SQL to Teradata (TTU) + IKM or MultiLoad instead - Only a single source set supported
Report the number of rows processed as an exception to the ODI Log (a task reporting the number of rows processed should appear as a warning in the log).

The following example specifies four FastLoad sessions: SESSION 4
The following example specifies ten FastLoad sessions with a minimum of five: SESSIONS 10 5
Uncheck this option if you want to keep the temporary TTU script after integration
Fields Separator when generating temporary files. Data must never contain this character. Default is |

Temporary directory where TTU scripts and temporary data files are stored. You can use relative URL, in this case URL should be relative to the folder where the ODI Agent has been launched.
Notes: - Paths should use specified using "/" on Unix and "\" on Windows. - When using TPT on windows paths must start with drive letter. - When using TPT paths must not contains any blanks.

Specify primary index for target table. Teradata uses the PI to spread data accross AMPs. It is important that the chosen PI has a high cardinality (many distint values) to ensure evenly spread data to allow maximum processing performance. Pleaes follow Teradata's recommandation on choosing a primary index, e.g. Teradata Database Design, Chapter "Primary Indexes" Valid options are [PK] Primary key of target table [UK] Update key set in interface <list of cols> This comma separated list of target columns defines the primary index. If no value is set (empty), no index will be created. NB: Teradata will automatically choose the first column of the table for the PI. [NOPI] Do not specify primary index for target table (Teradata 13.0 & above only).

Choose the teradata utility to load data choose: TPUMP to use tpump utility MLOAD to use multiload utility FASTLOAD to use fastload utility TPT-LOAD to use parallel transporter (load operator) TPT-SQL-INSERT to use parallel transporter (sql insert operator)
For details and appropriate choice of utility/ load operator, see Teradata documentation: TPUMP Teradata Parallel Data Pump Reference MLOAD Teradata MultiLoad Reference FASTLOAD Teradata FastLoad Reference TPT-LOAD Teradata Parallel Transporter Reference Teradata Parallel Transporter User Guide TPT-SQL-INSERT Teradata Parallel Transporter Reference Teradata Parallel Transporter User Guide

Maximum number of tolerated errors. This corresponds to - ERRLIMIT command in FastLoad, MultiLoad and TPump - ErrorLimit attribute in TPT Load operator Note: TPT SQL Insert operator does not support any error limit. This option is ignored for TPT-SQL-INSERT.

This option generates an extra validation step during development. Validations performed are: - Validation of TERADATA_UTILITY option - Validation of MULTILOAD_TPUMP_TYPE option - Validation of ODI_DDL option - Validation of target data types for FastLoad and TPT-Load
This option should be turned off for all production use in particular for high-frequency execution. There is not added value in production, only processing overhead.
Check this option if you wish to delete all the rows of the target datastore.
Use named pipes for data transport?
For more information about named pipes with Teradata utilities, see "Teradata Tools and Utilities Access Modules"
TD access module for NP to use

Depending on platform the Teradata utility is used, differnt Teradata access modules need to be used for named pipes:
For FastLoad, MultiLoad and TPump: - np_axsmod.sl on HP-UX platforms - np_axsmod.so on MP-RAS; IBM-AIX; Solaris SPARC and Solaris Opteron platforms - np_axsmod.dll on Windows platforms
For TPT: - np_axsmodTWB.sl on HP-UX platforms - np_axsmodTWB.so on MP-RAS; IBM-AIX; Solaris SPARC and Solaris Opteron platforms - np_axsmodTWB.dll on Windows platforms
Please refer to TTU and TD access module documentation for more details.

When using named pipes, the TTU creates the named pipe and then accepts data. So before spooling out data into the pipe, the KM waits the specified number of seconds after starting the TTU before spooling data into pipe. The time depends on utility used, platform, CPU workload, network connectivity and so forth and need to be adapted to used systems. Please take into account that this time also needs to fit production environments.
When using named pipes, this options specifies, whether the agent running this interface is on Windows.
Check this option if you wish to create the target table.

Operation performed by load utility (only for MULTILOAD and TPUMP)
choose: INSERT (insert new data) UPSERT (insert new data and update exising) DELETE (delete existing data)

This option is intended for development use only. Do NOT use in production!
If activated, drops all Teradata utility tables like - acquisition error table - application error table - log table - work table

The generation of DDL commands can be controlled by setting ODI_DDL: DROP_CREATE Drop and recreate all ODI temp tables at every execution CREATE_DELETE_ALL Create all temp tables (ignore warnings) and use DELETE ALL DELETE_ALL Only submit DELETE ALL for all temp tables NONE Do not submit any DDL

<% if (odiRef.getOption( "ODI_DDL" ).indexOf( "CREATE" )>-1) { %>

create set table <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "TARG_NAME", "A")%>
(
	<%=odiRef.getTargetColList("", "[COL_NAME]\t[DEST_WRI_DT]", ",\n\t", "")%>
)
<% /* use update key for PI ? */
      if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").equals("[UK]")) 
          out.print( odiRef.getColList("primary index (", "[COL_NAME]", ",", ")", "UK") );
      /* use primary key for PI ? */
      else if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").equals("[PK]")) 
          out.print( odiRef.getColList("unique primary index (", "[COL_NAME]", ",", ")", "PK") );
     /* No PI ? */
      else if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").equals("[NOPI]")) 
          out.print( " no primary index " );
      /* use column list for PI ? */
      else if (odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX").length() > 0) 
          out.print( "primary index (" + odiRef.getOption("PRIMARY_INDEX") + ")" );
%>

<%} else {%>
-- Disabled by ODI_DDL option
<%}%>

from jarray import array from java.lang import Thread from java.io import BufferedOutputStream from java.io import PrintStream from java.lang import String from java.lang import Runtime from java.lang import System from java.io import StringWriter from java.io import InputStreamReader from java.io import OutputStreamWriter from java.io import BufferedReader from java.io import BufferedWriter from java.io import FileReader from java.io import FileWriter from jarray import array from jarray import zeros import com.sunopsis.dwg.tools.SqlUnload as JSnpsSqlUnload import java.util.Vector as JVector import threading import time import os
# # Source connection variables # srcdriver = "<%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_JAVA_DRIVER")%>" srcurl = "<%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_JAVA_URL")%>" srcuser = "<%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_USER_NAME")%>" srcpass = "<%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_ENCODED_PASS")%>" fetchsize = "<%=odiRef.getInfo("SRC_FETCH_ARRAY")%>"
# # Temporary Files variables # filename = r"<%=odiRef.getOption("TEMP_DIR")%>/<%=odiRef.getTable("L", "TARG_NAME", "W")%>.%s" logname = filename % "log" scriptname = filename % "script" outname = filename % "out" dataname = r"<% if (odiRef.getOption("NP_USE_NAMED_PIPE").equals("1") && odiRef.getOption("NP_EXEC_ON_WINDOWS").equals("1")) { out.print( ("//./pipe/odi_pipe_"+odiRef.getPop("I_POP") ).replaceAll("/","\\") ); } else { out.print( odiRef.getOption("TEMP_DIR")+"/"+odiRef.getTable("L", "TARG_NAME", "W")+".data" ); }; %>"
# # Unload Options # fieldsep = "<%=odiRef.getOption("FIELD_SEP")%>" datefmt = "yyyyMMddHHmmss.SSS" query = """select <%=odiRef.getPop("DISTINCT_ROWS")%> <%=odiRef.getColList("", "\t[EXPRESSION]", ",\n", "", "(INS or UPD) and REW")%> from <%=odiRef.getFrom()%> where (1=1) <%=odiRef.getJoin()%> <%=odiRef.getFilter()%> <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter() %> <%=odiRef.getGrpBy()%> <%=odiRef.getHaving()%> """
# # Load Options # loadcmd = r"""<% if (odiRef.getOption( "TERADATA_UTILITY" ).equals( "FASTLOAD" )) { %>fastload < "%s" > "%s"<% } else if (odiRef.getOption( "TERADATA_UTILITY" ).equals( "MLOAD" )) { %>mload < "%s" > "%s"<% } else if (odiRef.getOption( "TERADATA_UTILITY" ).equals( "TPUMP" )) { %>tpump < "%s" > "%s"<% } else { %>tbuild -f "%s" > "%s"<%};%> """ loadcmd = loadcmd % (scriptname, logname) utility = r"""<% if (odiRef.getOption( "TERADATA_UTILITY" ).equals( "FASTLOAD" )) { %>fastload<% } else if (odiRef.getOption( "TERADATA_UTILITY" ).equals( "MLOAD" )) { %>mload<% } else if (odiRef.getOption( "TERADATA_UTILITY" ).equals( "TPUMP" )) { %>tpump<% } else { %>tbuild -f %s<%};%> """ <% if (odiRef.getOption( "TERADATA_UTILITY" ).startsWith( "TPT" )) { %> % (scriptname)<%};%>
lf = None
class Gobbler(Thread): def __init__(self, stream, label): self.br = BufferedReader(InputStreamReader(stream)) self.label = label def run(self): line=self.br.readLine() while (line != None): print >> lf, self.label + line line=self.br.readLine() #print >>lf, "ODI: End of polling of " + self.label
class Writer(Thread): def __init__(self, stream): self.ps = PrintStream(BufferedOutputStream(stream)) def run(self): fsrc = open(r"<%=odiRef.getOption("TEMP_DIR")%>/<%=odiRef.getTable("L", "TARG_NAME", "W")%>.script", "r") try: for lsrc in fsrc.readlines(): self.ps.println(lsrc) finally: fsrc.close() self.ps.flush() self.ps.close()
#=========================== # snpssqlunload() # executes the SnpsSQLUnload API #=========================== def snpssqlunload(): snpunload = JSnpsSqlUnload()
# Set the parameters cmdline = JVector() cmdline.add(array(["-DRIVER", srcdriver], String)) cmdline.add(array(["-URL", srcurl], String)) cmdline.add(array(["-USER", srcuser], String)) cmdline.add(array(["-PASS", srcpass], String)) cmdline.add(array(["-FILE_FORMAT", "variable"], String)) cmdline.add(array(["-FIELD_SEP", fieldsep], String)) cmdline.add(array(["-FETCH_SIZE", fetchsize], String)) cmdline.add(array(["-FILE", dataname], String)) cmdline.add(array(["-DATE_FORMAT", datefmt], String)) cmdline.add(array(["-QUERY", query], String)) snpunload.setParameters(cmdline)
# Start the unload process snpunload.execute()
#=========================== # load() # executes the file based loadd #=========================== def load(): if os.system(loadcmd) <> 0 : raise "Load Error", "See %s for details" % logname
#=========================== # pipedload() # executes the piped fast or multiload #=========================== def pipedload(): <%if (odiRef.getOption("NP_EXEC_ON_WINDOWS").equals("0")) {%> pipename = dataname # Create or Replace a unix fifo os.system("rm %s" % pipename) if os.system("mkfifo %s" % pipename) <> 0: raise "mkfifo error", "Unable to create fifo %s" % pipename <%};%>
# Start the load command in a dedicated thread proc = Runtime.getRuntime().exec( utility ) # Prepare stdin, stdout, stderr processing stdOutGobbler = Gobbler(proc.getInputStream(),"") stdErrGobbler = Gobbler(proc.getErrorStream(),"StdErr: ") stdIn = Writer(proc.getOutputStream()) stdOutGobbler.start() stdErrGobbler.start() # Spool script into TTU stdIn.start() # Wait for end of spool, just in case there is a timeout stdIn.join(10000)
# now that the TTU thead has started, wait # some seconds to see if it is running time.sleep(<%=odiRef.getOption("NP_TTU_STARTUP_TIME")%>)
# Check, if process is still alive isAlive = 1 try: rc = proc.exitValue() isAlive = 0 except: pass if (isAlive == 0): <%if (odiRef.getOption("NP_EXEC_ON_WINDOWS").equals("0")) {%> # Remove pipe before we stop os.system("rm %s" % pipename) <%};%> # Report error raise "Load process did not start or has stopped immediately. See %s for details." % (logname)
# Start unload process try: snpssqlunload() except: # if the unload process fails, we have to kill # the load process on the OS. proc.destroy() <%if (odiRef.getOption("NP_EXEC_ON_WINDOWS").equals("0")) {%> # remove the pipe os.system("rm %s" % pipename) <%};%> raise
#print >>lf, "ODI: Unload completed successfully. Waiting for load to finish..." # At this point, the unload() process has finished, so we need to wait # for the load process to finish proc.waitFor() #print >>lf, "ODI: Load completed. RC=%d" % rc # Wait for last output to be processed by Gobblers, time out just in case stdOutGobbler.join(10000) stdErrGobbler.join(10000) rc = proc.exitValue() if (rc <> 0): raise "Load failed. Please see %s for details." % logname
<% if (odiRef.getOption("NP_USE_NAMED_PIPE").equals("1")) { %> try: lf = open(logname, "w+") pipedload() finally: lf.flush() lf.close() <%} else {%> snpssqlunload() load() <%};%>

<% if ("C".equals(odiRef.getJrnInfo( "JRN_METHOD"))) { %> /* Consistant journalization detected. */ /* Lock should be done by a specific step in a package */ <% } else { %> delete from <%=odiRef.getTable("L","JRN_NAME","A")%> where JRN_CONSUMED = '1' <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter()%> <% } %>

try: # Delete script file os.remove(scriptname) finally: pass
<% if (odiRef.getOption("NP_USE_NAMED_PIPE").equals("0")) {%> try: # Delete dump file os.remove(dataname) finally: pass <%};%>
<% if (odiRef.getOption("TERADATA_UTILITY").equals("MLOAD")) {%> release mload <%=odiRef.getTable("L", "TARG_NAME", "A")%> <%} else {%> -- Only needed for MLOAD <%};%>

<%if ("C".equals(odiRef.getJrnInfo("JRN_METHOD"))){%> /* Consistant journalization detected. */ /* Lock should be done by a specific step in a package */ <% } else { %> update <%=odiRef.getTable( "L" , "JRN_NAME" , "A" )%> set JRN_CONSUMED = '1' where (1=1) <%=odiRef.getJrnFilter()%> <% } %>
